y4ZNhErO6_H109WGHoVhTw.text: The worst service I have ever experienced. Had to wait 15 minutes before anyone came to the table. Actually threw the forks and knives at us. Rude waiters. Would NEVER recommend or go back

aa_eZRjnH_uHTaLNMo435g.text: food was good & fresh.service was sarcastic but on top of things.prices are decent but can be on the high end.reservations are a good idea.will definitely go back to try other items on the menu.

iKh2G8QVChyr5vc9bvXNhw.text: The atmosphere was nice, but overall I didn't get a sense that we were welcome there. When I asked about what was a good pasta, they recommended the most expensive dishes on the menu. I have friends that have gone here and loved it, but I just didn't have the same experience. I will say that the dish I had was outstanding, but I felt we were cramped in the corner of the restaurant.

3u3hN9WupgjRoBm4Sm6I_w.text: The best restaurant in London, bar none!!

a78SSitu9wJUYItJdavmpA.text: A Delightful RespiteWe found this little gem on a side alley across the street from Harrods. I ordered the grilled salmon with dill sauce and sautéed spinach. It was perfect!  My daughter ordered the fagoli soup and the eggplant rotini. It too was delicious. The service was efficient and quite "city"'like, not overly friendly. The receptionist on the other hand was warm and gracious. An added treat was the Galani they served as a final treat. The prices were reasonable and the atmosphere very inviting.

F9GY1ZaR-vDLwGLBgtk8Sw.text: Amazing food ! Finally found a place where the staff is trained for, and know what they are doing. Experienced staff

UVClB9TNt0kgRUCEedFc0g.text: Excellent Classic Italian food in the center of London! Definitely recommend as it will not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom

juBhmj0M7wNAdEUSm39low.text: nice food. but after placing the order, we waited for nearly 1 hour to get our starter. they said there's someting wrong with their computer but other tables all get their food on time⋯⋯

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom

oFUH9Xlj2DF7B2bfUaIB6A.text: Came here for lunch upon recommendation from a friend who ate here a couple years ago. Looked like a solid choice from the outside because it was packed full of people. We went in an were greeted by a friendly host who took our coats and seated us. The menu here is quite extensive, but we finally made some solid choices. We started with the Antipasto Romano which came with traditional roman antipasti of salami, parma ham, artichoke, olives and fried pecorino cheese. Can't go wrong with this. For mains, we ordered a meat pasta and fried calamari, scallops, etc. I wasn't too impressed with the pasta (sorry, the name of it escapes me). Of course, the fried seafood mix was very good. Service was lacking here. They were very slow with bringing out water, bread, the food. Although Signor Sassi is a decent place for Italian, there are many more places I'd rather go to.

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom. Pasta
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom. Fried Seafood
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom. Antipasto Romano

kleIP1YD9bZa6MmRp-Tniw.text: Great authentic Italian food! This little gem is tucked away in an alley and was a little difficult to find. However, once in, you are greeted by warm staff members who take your coat right away. The food was delicious. Nothing was over-cooked or anything. The calamari particularly was delicious. The ravioli dishes that we tried were also excellent and full of flavor. The lobster sauce was beyond amazing. Would definitely come back here

Jt74ge1mOiTiO5PKjx9XpA.text: i would not recommend it high price and less welcoming and responding reception and the food less than averege

EPyZ_zu_peDzV3qmqguj8Q.text: BEST SPAGHETTI!!! The tomato sauce is soo good. I was surprised I liked the lobster spaghetti and prawn spaghetti (spicy w/capers) as much as I did since I've liked both less as I've gotten older for some reason. The waiter mentioned the chef was using (I THINK) Marzano tomatoes which are evidently the best. Fantastic service, too. They are old-school Italians and make you feel at home!

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom. Best lobster spaghetti
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom. Summer salad w/white truffle & quail eggs

ByanOX7h5EeC40fS0Bzw2w.text: All around, excellent food. I would come back in a heartbeat. Great Italian food in the heart of London. Thank you for being a great host Carman.

Fg7ltMlK1su7L0sRAWBPLw.text: Amazing location with an outstanding food. Service is good and quick, I never tried it for lunch (not sure if they do). Dinners are always booked so make sure to suit your self!Seafood are quite taste and starts as usual are perfect.

9OdZadMt_UW74oV4sIIstw.text: Chicken was so flavourful - tasted all the lime, spices and olive oil at the same time, super tender even though it was chicken breast.A lot of fresh seafood just sitting on top of a huge bucket of ice by the front door - how cool!Desserts were really good too - tiramisu had strong hints of coffee, yum and the profiteroles were SO good. so was the chocolate mousse and the blueberry gelato.Pretty crowded in here though so if you're looking for a quiet place, this is more of a loud crowd with people speaking in italian and waiters looking like they're straight out of an italian painting - moustaches and all haha

G0V9HD_Z-UD6rLcl-hNYCw.text: A group ofus decided to try Signor Sassi and I have to say it was the perfect place.The food was exquisite, service was very friendly and helpful and theatmosphere was exactly right for us. All of our dishes were very tasty andpresented well. Great evening!

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom

bDEaHMjokpTkCeOLIo7v_g.text: Superb food!!! Extremely lively place and great service!!! Best spagetti ali olio with chilli oul!!!

mcYyqW7OKn0-ijoShefm4g.text: Food excellent...  Loud yet friendly atmosphere.  Attentive service.  A bit hard to find, but enough off the beaten path that not too touristy although just across from Harrods.

e8-6LtZIEkLcNnOlbrZ7qA.text: Previously run and I believe owned by Mario of Scalini fame, this restaurant is tucked away of a fairly grubby side street of Knightsbridge but it one of the best. It has a loyal fan base and is used a lot by Italian families and a fair share of celebrities and sports stars - just look at the pictures on the walls. A very well tried and tested formula that a)works and b) is very good and c)good value for money.Menu doesn't change but it is that good that it shouldn't and a warm welcome is always assured. Food is typically Italian and I have never had anything like a bad meal in there, in fact it has always been top quality. Waiters are always happy and they sign a lot which is always funny and adds to a great lunch or dinner. Please make the time to go and eat here, it really is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom

UDPvudHM7piwXTE1j03WgA.text: The food was very good. The atmosphere was fun and crowded. Make sure you look over the bill carefully, they charged us for things we didn't order and charged full price for half orders. Added up to 50 pounds to the bill. Would I go back? Probably, but be alert

p13coMgowyL9hYxpSJhYuA.text: so i have one week left in london, and i'm trying to clear out my bookmarks!  my friend ck has been RAVING about the lobster spaghetti since i've been here, and we finally made it a point to go before my return to the states.the lobster spaghetti was amazing, and we also had the spicy spaghetti w/ prawns.  both were fab, and i scarfed it down.  even the signor sassi salad was delicious.  so why the 4 stars?  service here is odd.  the guy taking our order was pretty rude, and then we had an overly attentive and flirtatious waiter.  it definitely made for an interesting experience.

oapa0CG5lT-dJPrL9wTwlA.text: The food here is always good italian food. Nothing that will blow away your tastebuds, but good. The pasta is always spot on.The desserts, unfortunately, are not of the same standard as the starters and mains. So perhaps having dessert somewhere else is a good idea (if dessert is as important to you as it is to me!)Also, the service here leaves alot to be desired.

MzLYPlrijCuGEskVISmkwA.text: The restaurant has a friendly staff and a good atmosphere, especially for dinners.

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom

_FsDd0pPy50KPfdurFPoBg.text: Found this place tucked in an alley while trying to get away from the crowds near Harrods. Very good service, and above par food. They had a black currant sorbet that was outstanding. Pricey and can be crowded. Pricey, but then again everything in London is.

cQzY-mfohpgFazRATrm8OQ.text: This was a very bittersweet experience, on that called to mind Proust's "Remembrance of Things Past," since my family used to live across the street from this place when it was Les Trois Canards, or what we called "three ducks," and it was our home away from home for super dinners for any occasion, or no occasion at all.The owner of the Three Ducks sold the space in '84, and these guys moved in. I haven't been back since, but on a recent trip to London, I figured I should hit the joint for a meal for old time's sake. And I'm glad I did.The menu is extensive, and it's not cheap. But the setting and service are terrific, and the food was pretty darn good, so I'd say value for money received, at least from my POV.I had a cocktail, a shrimp dish, and a salad, along with a glass of wine. I was drenched in memories of the Three Ducks - not the same experience, but one that had me thinking I'd happily visit the place again on my next London trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful arugula salad - some of the best arugula I've ever had - with shaved grana and grape tomatoes. Luscious.
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom. Shrimp in a gorgonzola cream sauce with hot pepper relish - it was IN. SANELY. good.

JAW3tyRo6ICcxt8wK6xCXw.text: Signor Sassi is a total tourist trap. Service is friendly but staff is busy and non-attentive.The biggest problem was that the food took at least 45 minutes and when it finally came out they messed up our order and forgot a few items. Nobody apologized.Ambiance is very rushed and cramped, and staff constantly bumped into my oddly place seat.Food is average at best. Think Olive Garden but at 5X the price.We were so disappointed and will not return.

xhFbN-DZ-ZowFLmp6W6GZQ.text: It is next harrods it so daaaaam goooood Italian food , order lobster spaghetti , ravioli shrimp, grilled salmon wasn't that impressive . I will  come again it is so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom. Grilled salmon with butter lemon souse
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom. Ravioli

zC3dosVpTEyalJ4uzXginQ.text: Found this place cramped - had a series of issues here including our main course "ticket" for food didn't print in the kitchen leading to 45 minutes after our reservation, we ate. And there was no sense of apology when they forgot to heed allergies or forgot to serve portions of the order. The food itself was hit and miss. Some was ok and some was good. Pasta pomodoro was good but fettuccini wasn't special. So I'd say this place is chaotic and not worth venturing into.

oHYUJfhBN1siLgyp4oSuXQ.text: My friends told me this restaurant is really good, especially the lobster pasta. So I just want to try and have a good dinner with my bf. we tried crab salad and scallops on spinach as starter, and we think scallops on spinach is really good with black pepper. And lobster risotto and pasta are both good,worthy to have a try.I really like the dessert in the blue plate, it tastes like a milk custard, like it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom

Kk3rETfFnDJLKnMrzL9UGw.text: It is such a delicious Italian place! The service is great and the food is full of flavor. My husband ordered the lobster spaghetti and it's truly a presentation! I ordered the mushroom risotto and it was packed of flavor. They used a few different mushroom varieties in the risotto and you can definitely tell. We ordered the ravioli also and no complaints there. The staff was attentive and our food came out really quick and it was super hot. I would definitely recommend going here!

vsmWDAbkdzfSgPerbyMdCg.text: This is a rubbish restaurant.  All the staffs are too busy to service the guest. They don't care the guests at all, but they limite the time which guests can sit down there. Even, the staff came to blame us that we stand up after long time waiting and without any services. The space of the restaurant is so narrow that you can't breathe. We didn't enjoy our food at all. Honestly, I have to say that was the worst experience I had after I lived in London four year!

f9faBJGHawi4ZRgN5JGHOw.text: It claim it's the best lobster spaghetti. I disappointed. And oyster is not fresh at all. And they charge 10 Pounds on hot water without noticing us. That was soooo funny.

dz5s-EXNRzizxXqCPcXHwQ.text: Lovely warm place to had fantastic food enjoy the real taste of Italian food, friendly staff that work hard to satisfy the customer

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom

ClyTV9REVVpEhr46yY2tfA.text: Maybe it was because my expectation was too high.  Nothing is special about their food.  For the main course, we got the lobster risotto and spaghetti,which are supposed to be their signature dishes.  However, both of them were disappointing.  Service was terrible.  We were seated in the corner and it always took them 5-10min to come and serve us. The bean salad and tiramisu were average as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom

UmtGfy6py_ORsv92KpDHvQ.text: For a person from Milan it's like opening a door and finding yourself at home... I went for dinner with two friends and we had some olives and parmesan to warm up and fish ad main (shallots with bread crumbs and pescatrice - both delicious!) Coffee is also good! Some limoncello and chiacchiere (typical carnival Italian pastry)... I would definitely recommend this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom. signor sassi

6Xb906IomIPw9r64WhxE9g.text: Amazing food and amazing people very friendly the fettuccine was absolutely amazing with potatoes and scallops I would highly recommend those dishes

HgjWa0gSWHDKsJV7I0MSAQ.text: This was the restaurant that finally converted me to loving olives, prior to that I hated them with a passion.    Aside from that I rathered enjoyed my time here. The service was great and I got myself a nice Italian wine. The décor in here is wild with a acid trip LSD swag but I think that adds to the charm of the restaurant. I went during December so I'm not sure if it was suppose to be Christmas decorations?I got myself the lobster risotto and Mt friend got the fettuccine. Both plates were good and I left a happy camper.

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom. Olives!!!! Yum.
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom. Funky decor

GxOCRkDU-Xprm8Wl3l3Q2Q.text: For the prices, I think its a bit over-priced for what you are getting. No doubt they've got lots of accolades and hype around the place but is it the best pasta I've eaten? Not too sure. Eitherway its still pretty good food all round.

nerp7wDYxEDfECHGm34xMQ.text: Always a plusWhenever you think of proper pasta and decent Italian food , it's the place to goYou need to make a booking as it is always full Love their truffle special menu A must try is he gnocchi truffles

USemq1VaUrMuk-58ue5Pvw.text: Unfortunately I was not given the opportunity to taste the food. My friend and I mentioned to the hostess that we were hoping for dessert and wine  , then asking if we should sit at the bar or a table. She insisted we sit at a table. Upon seating, we asked for the dessert menu. The waiter walked away and said they would not help us without ordering dinner. If this was policy and we were told at the door it would have been acceptable. But the manner in which we were told we would not be served was offensive and ill mannered. While visiting London I have been treated quite wonderfully with all staff until I arrived here. As a result of their rude nature in asking us to leave, I can not recommend this place and will suggest my friends avoid moving forward.

lV0HtQAeYqT0-HLbgh8_6Q.text: I was really looking forward to trying this spot with a great location near Harrods I was expecting a lot. The place was filled at 9:30 and all the servers were Italian made me think it was even more authentic. I was greatly mistaken! The food was so basic and very low quality and fines put into the dieshes. The pastas were all bland (we got the alfredo and puttanesca) I would not ever recommend this to someone. The service was excellent hence my rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom

3pkY2tl1pnEnNR25LZRppA.text: The best spaghetti carbonara around!!! My favorite restaurant in London. Everything I've had has been amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom

MvImOAtIuc3dlS3firzaAw.text: Great food - on spot, materiel really fresh. Love the Risotto Signor Sassi, very delicious; desert is amazing Service is a bit on the slow side - but waiters are really nice and funnyP.S great location - just across the street of Harrods

iMiq-8dhTfIhvc6BB_lYHA.text: Quaint place, great customer service with delicious food! It is a lovely little hideaway.

photos.caption: Photo of Signor Sassi - London, United Kingdom. Lobster Spaghetti
